title: How to Make Guinea Pig Granola Bars

steps.headline: Obtain your equipment and ingredients.
steps.description: For this how-to, you will need a mixing bowl, spatula, measuring cup, cutting knife and a pan. For your ingredients you will need to purchase guinea pig pellets and a variety of fruits or vegetables of your choice.

steps.headline: Add the pellets to a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Add a small portion of water slowly until the pellets soak up the water and turn to a soggy consistency. Mix them with a spatula so the texture is even.

steps.headline: Chop up your veggies.
steps.description: Cut your vegetables or fruits to a thin slice or into small cubes and add them to the pellet mixture. Mix with your spatula.

steps.headline: Add your mixture to a pan and place in your oven.
steps.description: Cook the mixture at 300 °F (149 °C) until the mixture is a light brown. Break one in half to make it's not too hard. As long as you can snap it in half, it's safe for your guinea pig to eat.

steps.headline: Obtain your equipment and ingredients.
steps.description: You will need a food processor, a mixing bowl, a spatula and a measuring cup. For your ingredients you will need guinea pig pellets, 1/4 cup of rolled oats and one to two apples.

steps.headline: Add pellets to a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Add a small portion of water and mix with your spoon until the pellets soak the water and become a soggy consistency.

steps.headline: Add oats and your apple to a food processor.
steps.description: The apple and oats should turn into smaller pieces. Mix these together with your pellet mixture.

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 300 degrees Fahrenheit.
steps.description: Place parchment paper into a square cake tin or pan, add your granola mixture and smoothly flatten the granola mixture into a square shape.

steps.headline: Cook your mixture until the granola turns a brown color.
steps.description: Once the mixture is cooked cut into small pieces and serve to your guinea pigs as a fun and healthy treat.

steps.headline: Gather your supplies.
steps.description: To make carrot granola bars, you will need dry oatmeal, wheat flour, ground carrots, and water. You will also need a food processor (or grater), a mixing bowl, a spatula, and a measuring cup.

steps.headline: Combine your ingredients in a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Add half a cup of oatmeal, half a cup of flour, half a cup of ground carrot, and half a cup of water in a bowl. Mix until smooth. Your carrot will have to be chopped up finely by using either a food processor or grater.

steps.headline: Mould your dough into square shaped granola bars.
steps.description: Place your bars on a tin or pan lined with parchment paper. You can use a mould to hold a better shape.

steps.headline: Bake your carrot granola bars at 350 °F (177 °C) for 15 minutes.
steps.description: Take them out of the oven once the granola bars have turned a golden brown colour.

steps.headline: Allow your granola bars to cool down.
steps.description: Give the carrot granola bars at least an hour before you feed them to your guinea pig/s. These items should be fed sparingly as a treat.

text: Traditional Granola Bars Obtain your equipment and ingredients. For this how-to, you will need a mixing bowl, spatula, measuring cup, cutting knife and a pan. For your ingredients you will need to purchase guinea pig pellets and a variety of fruits or vegetables of your choice. Add the pellets to a mixing bowl. Add a small portion of water slowly until the pellets soak up the water and turn to a soggy consistency. Mix them with a spatula so the texture is even. Chop up your veggies. Cut your vegetables or fruits to a thin slice or into small cubes and add them to the pellet mixture. Mix with your spatula. Add your mixture to a pan and place in your oven. Cook the mixture at 300 °F (149 °C) until the mixture is a light brown. Break one in half to make it's not too hard. As long as you can snap it in half, it's safe for your guinea pig to eat. Apple Oat Granola Bars Obtain your equipment and ingredients. You will need a food processor, a mixing bowl, a spatula and a measuring cup. For your ingredients you will need guinea pig pellets, 1/4 cup of rolled oats and one to two apples. Add pellets to a mixing bowl. Add a small portion of water and mix with your spoon until the pellets soak the water and become a soggy consistency. Add oats and your apple to a food processor. The apple and oats should turn into smaller pieces. Mix these together with your pellet mixture. Preheat your oven to 300 degrees Fahrenheit. Place parchment paper into a square cake tin or pan, add your granola mixture and smoothly flatten the granola mixture into a square shape. Cook your mixture until the granola turns a brown color. Once the mixture is cooked cut into small pieces and serve to your guinea pigs as a fun and healthy treat. Carrot Granola Bars Gather your supplies. To make carrot granola bars, you will need dry oatmeal, wheat flour, ground carrots, and water. You will also need a food processor (or grater), a mixing bowl, a spatula, and a measuring cup. Combine your ingredients in a mixing bowl. Add half a cup of oatmeal, half a cup of flour, half a cup of ground carrot, and half a cup of water in a bowl. Mix until smooth. Your carrot will have to be chopped up finely by using either a food processor or grater. Mould your dough into square shaped granola bars. Place your bars on a tin or pan lined with parchment paper. You can use a mould to hold a better shape. Bake your carrot granola bars at 350 °F (177 °C) for 15 minutes. Take them out of the oven once the granola bars have turned a golden brown colour. Allow your granola bars to cool down. Give the carrot granola bars at least an hour before you feed them to your guinea pig/s. These items should be fed sparingly as a treat.
sentences: Traditional Granola Bars Obtain your equipment and ingredients.
For this how-to, you will need a mixing bowl, spatula, measuring cup, cutting knife and a pan.
For your ingredients you will need to purchase guinea pig pellets and a variety of fruits or vegetables of your choice.
Add the pellets to a mixing bowl.
Add a small portion of water slowly until the pellets soak up the water and turn to a soggy consistency.
Mix them with a spatula so the texture is even.
Chop up your veggies.
Cut your vegetables or fruits to a thin slice or into small cubes and add them to the pellet mixture.
Mix with your spatula.
Add your mixture to a pan and place in your oven.
Cook the mixture at 300 °F (149 °C) until the mixture is a light brown.
Break one in half to make it's not too hard.
As long as you can snap it in half, it's safe for your guinea pig to eat.
Apple Oat Granola Bars Obtain your equipment and ingredients.
You will need a food processor, a mixing bowl, a spatula and a measuring cup.
For your ingredients you will need guinea pig pellets, 1/4 cup of rolled oats and one to two apples.
Add pellets to a mixing bowl.
Add a small portion of water and mix with your spoon until the pellets soak the water and become a soggy consistency.
Add oats and your apple to a food processor.
The apple and oats should turn into smaller pieces.
Mix these together with your pellet mixture.
Preheat your oven to 300 degrees Fahrenheit.
Place parchment paper into a square cake tin or pan, add your granola mixture and smoothly flatten the granola mixture into a square shape.
Cook your mixture until the granola turns a brown color.
Once the mixture is cooked cut into small pieces and serve to your guinea pigs as a fun and healthy treat.
Carrot Granola Bars Gather your supplies.
To make carrot granola bars, you will need dry oatmeal, wheat flour, ground carrots, and water.
You will also need a food processor (or grater), a mixing bowl, a spatula, and a measuring cup.
Combine your ingredients in a mixing bowl.
Add half a cup of oatmeal, half a cup of flour, half a cup of ground carrot, and half a cup of water in a bowl.
Mix until smooth.
Your carrot will have to be chopped up finely by using either a food processor or grater.
Mould your dough into square shaped granola bars.
Place your bars on a tin or pan lined with parchment paper.
You can use a mould to hold a better shape.
Bake your carrot granola bars at 350 °F (177 °C) for 15 minutes.
Take them out of the oven once the granola bars have turned a golden brown colour.
Allow your granola bars to cool down.
Give the carrot granola bars at least an hour before you feed them to your guinea pig/s.
These items should be fed sparingly as a treat.
